BigIdea: The boys createHockey Z-9.
Disappearance: An ice resurfacer hit by Doofenshmirtz's Abominable-inator clears the Z-9 course away.
Notes: This is similar toFootball X-7from "My Fair Goalie".They saved the name "Y-8" for croquet.

BigIdea: The boys plan their ownNew Year's Eve ball drop, complete with a customized multi-dimensional ball.
Disappearance: Ferb launches the ball into outer space, and it explodes into fireworks.
Notes: This is inspired byVivian, who hypes up the tradition of staying up to watch ball drop.

BigIdea: They create agiant rocket-powered tire swing.
Disappearance: Buford presses a red button that reads "FLY", and it goes up into the sky.
Notes: Buford removes a piece of the console, causing it to emit a beam that can turna humaninto a fly. When the tire swing disappears, Phineas moves a certain lever to turn the panel into aSorbet Machine.

BigIdea: They build theDental Hygienosphere, a tooth-themed amusement park ride.
Disappearance: Buford is hit by Doofenshmirtz's Luffa-Plex-Dill-Pickle-inator and sent into orbit; his shoelaces get caught on a stray decoration, taking the ride with him.
Notes: The ray pulls Buford up with the ride.

BigIdea: The boys restore and trick outLawrence'sold carfor Candace.
Disappearance: The car doesn't disappear; in fact, Linda and Lawrence see it but they think that the latter is responsible for it.
Notes: The car wins Best in Show at the Doo Wop Hop.

BigIdea: The boys createrutabaga-themed vehiclesfor the Running of the Chinchillas.
Disappearance: The vehicles were trampled by the oversized chinchillas.
Notes: All the kids were also trampled, but unhurt.

BigIdea: The boys build a metal superstructure.
Disappearance: Not seen, but the superstructure is carried away by what seems to be a magnetized cloud.
Notes: The invention is not seen in the episode.

BigIdea: Baljeet has problems with making decisions, so the boys devise apossibility machineto help him.
Disappearance: Liam's giant Boomerang destroys the machine thus reverting Baljeet back to only himself.
Notes: When Baljeet had to make a choice he would be copied into two Baljeets and then three Baljeets and so on.

BigIdea: The boys build amind share device.
Disappearance: Satellite: N/AMind Share Machine: Morg and his friends made it self-destruct.
Notes: After seeing a commercial of Morg in taking a vacation into another planet.

BigIdea: They make aninvention out of recycled parts.
Disappearance: It doesn't disappear, but Candace can't see it clearly when zapped by Doofenshmirtz's Eye-Fog-inator while Linda thinks she's hallucinating.
Notes: The invention uses parts from past ones.

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb create agiant wading poolfor their Mom.
Disappearance: Pheromones latch onto the pool, attracting a swarm of bees, which lifts the structure into the air, where it pops.
Notes: They are inspired to build it after learning of Linda's playtimes with Candace. Their old pool ends up being the only unaffected part.

BigIdea: Isabella borrows the sorbet machine that can turn her and theFireside Girlsinto bees.
Disappearance: It does not disappear, but after a few hours, the effects wear off and they become themselves again.
Notes: The Fireside Girls need it to earn their Beekeeping Patch. The machine is also seen in "Bee Day".

BigIdea: They make anenormous water droplet.
Disappearance: The liquid ball hits a prickly structure, causing all the water to be released into an empty hole.
Notes: It is inspired by Baljeet, who had refreshed his knowledge on surface tension in physics camp.

BigIdea: They amplify Buford's senses to those of a dog using asensorial helmet.
Disappearance: Buford runs into the City Hall, where he eventually takes it off.Don, a City Hall tour guide, is later seen running out of the edifice with the helmet on.
Notes: The invention is inspired by Isabella, who findsher dogmissing.

BigIdea: They make a giantreplica of the Gordian Knotout of licorice.
Disappearance: Candace is zapped by the stray gun of Doofenshmirtz's All-You-Can-Eat-Buffet-Inator, causing her to eat the entire project.
Notes: N/A

BigIdea: They set off to search for a rare Chupacabra by using theirChupa-Copter.
Disappearance: The Chupacabra is actually an animal agent, Agent CH, so Perry uses the Switch Place-inator, making it switch places with Buford, and it flies away on the Chupa-Copter.
Notes: Inspired by Buford's grandfather hunting the Chupacabra.

BigIdea: They throw a birthday party for Isabella.
Disappearance: It doesn't disappear, but the grand finale is turned into butterflies.
Notes: The grand finale is not seen, but part of it is mentioned as being a laser light show with swans.All Isabella wants for her birthday is alone time with Phineas.

BigIdea: The boys create alaser light showfor the grand finale of the block party.
Disappearance: Norm's head clings to the P.H.L.A.S.E.R. and flies off to space before it is scheduled to do so.
Notes: They had been instructed by Linda to hire a company to handle it.

BigIdea: Isabella, Ginger, Buford, Baljeet, Candace and Stacy compete in anobstacle course eventhosted by Phineas and Ferb.
Disappearance: It doesn't disappear, but a camera is zapped by the 90-Degree-Turn-inator, causing it to smash the jumbotron pole into blocking Linda's view of the entire project.
Notes: To do the project, Phineas and Ferb use the leftover building materials of the Backyard Hodge Podge.

BigIdea: In the beginning of the special, Phineas and the gang use the satellite from their space-station to power up their rocket-powered surfboards tosurf the asteroid belts. Later, they build a Secret Hideout for Emergency Defense (or S.H.E.D. for short) full of machines to help the Marvel superheroes get their powers back.
Disappearance: It is never explained what happened to S.H.E.D., but Candace accidentally makes the space station crash down to Earth, and Doofenshmirtz disintegrates it with his Disintegrator-inator.
Notes: N/A

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb recreate the Trojan War.
Disappearance: The flying chariots get tangled up with the Trojan Dinosaur, and they fall onto the castle, crashing everything. Later, Lawrence gets zapped by Doofenshmirtz's De-Clutter-Inator, causing him to clean up the wreckage.
Notes: This was originally supposed to be the big idea in "I Scream, You Scream", but was cancelled due to Isabella having her tonsils removed.

BigIdea: The boys host a giant Halloween party.
Disappearance: N/A
Notes: Ferb mashes up and remixes past songs.

BigIdea: The boys create afoam circuitas a safe place to skateboard without having to worry about bruising.
Disappearance: The batDerekflies through Foam Town multiple times, colliding Doofenshmirtz with it several times, eventually loosening the giant bolt enough for the structure to roll away to the desert.
Notes: Buford is the one who motivates the kids to build it, because he can't afford to go to the hospital for any possible injuries.

BigIdea: They make alarge scrapbook albumcontaining Candace and Jeremy's moments as a present for Jeremy's birthday.
Disappearance: Candace gets hit by Doofenshmirtz's Worst-Fear-inator, causing her to state her worst fear of the Scrapbook-aganza flying away before Jeremy arrives. It does exactly that.
Notes: Candace had been having trouble figuring out what to get for Jeremy, so she asks Phineas and Ferb to help her.

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb playtennis in zip-lines.
Disappearance: After the effects of the Stinklekrampen-Inator wear off due to Perry destroying it, the contraption sinks into a crack in the Earth after Candace proclaims the improbability of that happening.
Notes: The idea of Sky Tennis is similar to that ofJetpack Volleyball("Sleepwalk Surprise").

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb hold anextreme batting contest.
Disappearance: After Buford hits all the levels in the cage and the ball goes into the target, jetpacks come out of it and carry the batting cages into the sky, where it then explodes into fireworks.
Notes: Phineas is inspired to create the challenge while listening to Baljeet and Buford's argument regarding the principles of hitting a baseball. It is revealed that they had built a giant water slide at Aqua Maximus.

BigIdea: The activity is reduced to background scenes. It somehow involves getting DNA out of a pool, and a giant human foot.
Disappearance: N/A
Notes: N/A

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb make atribute-to-summer concertand also save it using a giant rocket engine.
Disappearance: N/A
Notes: Doofenshmirtz inadvertently helps the gang to save the summer.

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb build abiplanefor their father.
Disappearance: Reg flies it away before Linda and Candace return.
Notes: N/A

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb construct awind amplificatorto fly enormous kites.
Disappearance: A storm hits and the kites are destroyed.
Notes: Doofenshmirtz's water spills into the machine and creates the storm.

BigIdea: They help the Fireside Girls with their puppet show by creating agiant marionette puppet.
Disappearance: Agent P uses it to fight Dennis the Rabbit, eventually destroying it.
Notes: N/A

BigIdea: The boys construct apicnic-themed amusement parkin Danville Park.
Disappearance: The entire environment and the people there-except Isabella and Phineas-are sent home by the Teleport-inator.
Notes: Isabella had been trying to spend time alone with Phineas, but fails after Ferb is hit by a ray from the Teleport-inator, sending him back to the backyard.

BigIdea: They try to helpLove HÃ¤ndelto findKlimpaloon.
Disappearance: N/A
Notes: N/A

BigIdea: The boys construct alarge art pieceout of various things in their kitchen drawers.
Disappearance: Phineas comes into contact with a beam from the Un-Retrograde-inator, causing him to undo the creation.
Notes: The inator somehow causes Phineas to lose his memory of him receiving Isabella's letter.

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb create anaroma machineto change the smell of the air. As a side gig, they attempt to make a device to undo Candace'sprojection.
Disappearance: N/A
Notes: The second contraption remains unfinished.

BigIdea: In a galaxy far far away from Summer, the counterparts of Phineas and Ferb try to return the blueprints of the death star to the rebels.During amontage, they also fix evaporators, train rats, and do several other things.
Disappearance: They return the plans.
Notes: N/A

BigIdea: A mysterious capsule falls into their yard and they use Ferb's Z-ray machine to investigate it.
Disappearance: A ray from the Unexist-inator hits the black hole, which has already sucked in the capsule and its residents.
Notes: This adventure is set in another reality; at the end of the episode, the original Phineas and Ferb are watching the whole strange scene through a portal from the sorbet machine.

BigIdea: The boys build amodel solar system racing tower.
Disappearance: A man buys it after being hit by the Motivator-inator.
Notes: The competition is called the Galaxy 5000; however, it is technically a 50-lap race. Phineas decides to name it as such so it sounds cooler.

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb build aRubberization Rayand use it to give their skin rubber-like qualities.Later, they make a pulley and a giant sprinkler to stop the Doof zombies.
Disappearance: The Doof Zombies destroy the Rubberization Ray.
Notes: The rubberization skin prevents them from getting transformed; Only few people survives from the pharmacist zombie outbreak.

Episode: "Tales from the Resistance: Back to the 2nd Dimension"
BigIdea: The alternate version of the boysplay sports, and venture to rescuePerry-2.
Disappearance: N/A
Notes: This happens in the2nd Dimension.

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb make modifications in their school yard.
Disappearance: N/A
Notes: This takes place when the school starts.

BigIdea: The teen Fireside Girls, along with Ferb, Buford, and Baljeet, set up aromantic dinnerfor Phineas and Isabella. In a flashback montage, Phineas is seen building a giant robot as a toddler, a popcorn machine as a younger kid, a generic machine at the main series age, an oversized can opener as a teenager, and a giant robotic eggplant as an adult.
Disappearance: The date is taken away by a moving dumpster steered by Doofenshmirtz's reckless driving.
Notes: Phineas does not participate in the gang's Big Idea.

BigIdea: Phineas and Ferb try to seize the last day of summer bydoing everything. They later use acatapultto get back in time.
Disappearance: The ultimate ride disappears in several ways during the time loops, a consequence of which being Phineas and Ferb's erasure from existence.
Notes: These are the last Big Ideas of the series' original run.

BigIdea: None
Disappearance: None
Notes: Phineas and Ferb only appear in the credits.
